frame.name: Body_parts
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame covers words for <fen>Body_part</fen>(s) (BP) belonging to a <fen>Possessor</fen> (Poss), which may be characterized by a <fen>Descriptor</fen> (Desc). The location of the BP may be identified in terms of its <fen>Attachment</fen> or its <fen>Orientational_location</fen>. A <fen>Subregion</fen> of a BP may also be indicated. <ex></ex> <ex>He had to brace <fex name="Possessor">his</fex> <fex name="Orientational_location">right</fex> <t><fex name="Body_part">arm</fex></t> against his leg in order to fight the roll.</ex>
<ex>The dog measured <fex name="Possessor">its</fex> <fex name="Descriptor">blond</fex> <t><fex name="Body_part">belly</fex></t> in the mud.</ex>
<ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element denotes the <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Poss">Kim's</fex> arm is broken.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element is used for a characteristic or description of the <fen>Body_part</fen>. Note that <fen>Descriptor</fen> is not an FE of the same character as other FEs. Specifically, rather than filling a slot, it identifies a modifier of its head noun.
<ex>Kim has <fex name="Desc">beautiful</fex> <t>eyes</t>.</ex> <ex>His <fex name="Desc">trembling</fex> <t>hands</t>....</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element is the <fen>Body_part</fen>. <ex>Kim's <fex name="Body_P">arm</fex> is broken.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FEidentifies the <fen>Subregion</fen> of the <fen>Body_part</fen> referred to by the target.
<ex><fex name="Subr">upper</fex> <t>arm</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Subr">lower</fex> <t>back</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Orientational_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element describes the location of the <fen>Body_part</fen> with respect to the inherent orientation of the body (or the larger body part) the <fen>Body_part</fen> is attached to.
<ex><fex name="OrLoc">left</fex> <t>leg</t></ex> <ex><fex name="OrLoc">hind</fex> <t>foot</t></ex> <ex><fex name="OrLoc">second</fex> <t>finger</t></ex> <ex><fex name="OrLoc">front</fex> <t>wings</t></ex>
NB: All of these (other than very productive types such as "left", "right", "front", "back", and "second") should be tagged as secondary targets.</def-root>

FE.name: Attachment
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Attachment</fen> is the larger body part to which the BP is attached. <ex>the <t>fingers</t> <fex name="Attachment">of her left hand</fex></ex> <ex>the <t>fin</t> <fex name="Attachment">on its back</fex></ex> <ex>the <fex name="Attachment">dorsal</fex> <t>fin</t></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: enkel.n
lexUnit.definition: dat de voet met het been verbindt

lexUnit.name: anus.n
lexUnit.definition: aan het eind van de endeldarm, waardoor de ontlasting naar buiten komt

lexUnit.name: aars.n
lexUnit.definition: van het darmkanaal, waardoor de onverteerde spijsresten het lichaam verlaten

lexUnit.name: maag.n
lexUnit.definition: tussen slokdarm en dunne darm waar je eten wordt verteerd

lexUnit.name: gewei.n
lexUnit.definition: van al of niet vertakte vorm, zoals die worden gedragen door herten, reebokken e.d.

lexUnit.name: long.n
lexUnit.definition: in de borst waarmee men ademhaalt
